    Screen - Interface in ui
    The Screen interface defines the contract for all screen classes in the application.

    SearchScreen - Class in ui
    The SearchScreen class represents the screen where users can search for a stock ticker, load from CSV, confirm, or exitâ€”with your new cohesive UI: animated gradient, stock-themed background image overlay, pill-shaped buttons with hover scaling, and click-flash feedback.

    selectCompany(String) - Method in class core.AppController
    Selects a company by its ticker symbol and fetches its stock data from a CSV file located in "src/CSV/".

    SellingScreen - Class in ui
    The SellingScreen class represents a UI screen where users can sell shares in the stock simulation.

    Constructs a new SellingScreen tied to the given DrawingSurface.
    sellStock(String, double, int) - Method in class simulation.Simulator
    Sells a specified number of shares of a stock if the user holds enough shares.
    sentiment - package sentiment
     
    SentimentAnalyzer - Class in sentiment
    SentimentAnalyzer based on Random Indexing + lexicon projection.
    SentimentAnalyzer() - Constructor for class sentiment.SentimentAnalyzer
    Constructs a new SentimentAnalyzer, initializing the sentiment axis by building the vector difference between positive and negative seed words.
    SentimentManager - Class in sentiment
    Manages the sentiment analysis workflow by coordinating news headline scraping and sentiment scoring for a given stock.
    SentimentManager() - Constructor for class sentiment.SentimentManager
    Constructs a new SentimentManager, initializing internal analyzer and scraper, and setting initial sentiment data to empty.

    ShortPoint - Class in data

    SimulationScreen - Class in ui
    Represents the screen for stock simulation.
    SimulationScreen(DrawingSurface, AppController) - Constructor for class ui.SimulationScreen
    Constructs a SimulationScreen instance, initializing the UI elements such as the stock tickers, graph box, and buttons.
    SimulationsScreen - Class in ui
    The SimulationsScreen class represents the simulations menu of the Stock Analyzer application with enhanced UI: stock-themed background image, animated gradient overlay, hover scaling, pill-shaped buttons, and emojis.
    SimulationsScreen(DrawingSurface) - Constructor for class ui.SimulationsScreen
    Constructs a SimulationsScreen with specified drawing surface.
    Simulator - Class in simulation
    The Simulator class is an abstract base class for running stock market simulations.
    Simulator() - Constructor for class simulation.Simulator
    Creates a new Simulator instance with the specified starting balance.
    sma(StockData, int) - Method in class prediction.Prediction
    Calculates the Simple Moving Average (SMA) prediction over the given period.
    sma(StockData, int) - Method in class prediction.PredictionManager
    Calculates the Simple Moving Average (SMA) prediction for the given stock data over the specified period.
    smoothing(StockData, double, double) - Method in class prediction.PredictionManager
    Applies Holt's linear exponential smoothing to the given stock data using the specified alpha (level smoothing) and beta (trend smoothing) parameters.
    startingBalance - Variable in class simulation.Simulator
     
    StockData - Class in data
    Represents a collection of stock price data for a specific ticker symbol.
    StockData(String) - Constructor for class data.StockData
    Constructs a StockData object for a given ticker symbol.
    StockData(ArrayList<PricePoint>, String) - Constructor for class data.StockData
    Constructs a StockData object with the specified list of PricePoints and a ticker symbol.
    StockDataFetcher - Class in data
    A utility class that provides methods for fetching stock data either from local CSV files or external sources (Yahoo Finance, AlphaVantage, and MarketStack).
    StockDataFetcher() - Constructor for class data.StockDataFetcher
     
    switchScreen(int) - Method in class ui.DrawingSurface
    Switches to a different screen by updating the current screen to the screen at the specified index.
